title: Ampersand Saks & Company
content:
Lifted from pic in today's business news report that Hudson's Bay may buy Saks.  
So I wonder what fonts or fonts have the comb over ampersand shown on the Saks & Company street level lettering?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130806004301im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AmpersandSaks&Company_5225.jpg)
  
Don
author: donshottype

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130806004301im_/http:/typophile.com/files/8517075_5079.jpg)
  
Detail from photograph by Ramin Talaie/Bloomberg , Financial Post.  
Don

Ah, after almost ten years somebody else has finally noticed that beauty.  
I haven't seen that form anywhere else, ever.

And "comb over": funny!

hhp

So this stumps the typophiles?  
Presumably this lettering style dates to when the store was designed by department store specialists Starrett & Van Vleck and built in 1922-24? The bronze letters may be more recent but the ampersand matches the style of the large letters over the entrance.  
See [photo of front entrance](http://web.archive.org/web/20130806004301/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/emilio_guerra/4956479090/), with architecural information.

Don

As an aside, note from the ID request photograph that one of the bronze quatrefoil design squares is missing. Perhaps suggestive of a company that may be ready for takeover.  
Don
